Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionClaim_Diagnosis
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Claim.diagnosis` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Claim.diagnosis` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Claim.diagnosis` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Claim.diagnosis` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `Claim.diagnosis` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `Claim.diagnosis` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `Claim.diagnosis` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Claim.diagnosis` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Claim.diagnosis`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
element.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.
element.requirements:
Necessary to maintain the order of the diagnosis items and provide a mechanism to link to claim details. Element `Claim.diagnosis.sequence` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Claim.diagnosis` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Claim.diagnosis.sequence` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Claim.diagnosis.sequence`, but has no comparisons.

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
element.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.
element.requirements:
Provides health context for the evaluation of the products and/or services. Element `Claim.diagnosis.diagnosis[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Claim.diagnosis` requires a cross-version extension.
Note that the target element context `Claim.diagnosis.diagnosis[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Claim.diagnosis`.
Element `Claim.diagnosis.diagnosis[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Claim.diagnosis.diagnosis[x]`, but has no comparisons.
